definition: in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
a type of standing harp, smaller than konghou 箜篌, with 5-25 strings
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)

sentences.english: These two air signs will hum together in life, through the ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 这两个风象星座会在生活的起起伏伏中琴瑟和鸣。

definition: lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
married couple very much in love/deep conjugal love
fig. the man sings and the woman follows/fig. marital harmony
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
string of pearl and jade (idiom); ideal combination/perfect pair
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
lit. lovely flowers, round moon (idiom); fig. everything is wonderful/perfect happiness/conjugal bliss
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
see 月下花前[yue4 xia4 hua1 qian2]
two hearts beat as one (idiom); a kindred spirit
gifted scholar, beautiful lady (idiom)/pair of ideal lovers
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
